trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 19

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Elf Weapon Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

trait.name: Fleet of Foot
trait.text: Your ground speed increases to 35 feet.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Elves love freedom, variety, and self-expression, so they lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They value and protect others' freedom as well as their own, and they are more often good than not.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 19

trait.name: Mul Daya Magic
trait.text: You know the chill touch cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hex spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the darkness spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Elf Weapon Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Elves love freedom, variety, and self-expression, so they lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They value and protect others' freedom as well as their own, and they are more often good than not.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Superior Darkvision
trait.text: Your Darkvision has a radius of 120 feet.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 18

trait.name: Skill Versatility
trait.text: You have proficiency with any combination of two other skills or tools of your choice.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Elves love freedom, variety, and self-expression, so they lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They value and protect others' freedom as well as their own, and they are more often good than not.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 17

trait.name: Grotag Tamer
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Animal Handling skill.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Goblins mature faster than humans, reaching adulthood at around age 12. They also age noticeably faster than humans, and even the most cautious goblins rarely live longer than 50 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most goblins are wildly chaotic, though they have no particular inclination toward good or evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Goblins average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Grit
trait.text: You have resistance to fire damage and psychic damage. In addition, when you are wearing no armor, your AC is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 17

trait.name: Lavastep Grit
trait.text: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky or subterranean environments.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Goblins mature faster than humans, reaching adulthood at around age 12. They also age noticeably faster than humans, and even the most cautious goblins rarely live longer than 50 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most goblins are wildly chaotic, though they have no particular inclination toward good or evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Goblins average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 17

trait.name: Tuktuk Cunning
trait.text: You have proficiency with thieves' tools.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Goblins mature faster than humans, reaching adulthood at around age 12. They also age noticeably faster than humans, and even the most cautious goblins rarely live longer than 50 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most goblins are wildly chaotic, though they have no particular inclination toward good or evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Goblins average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Grit
trait.text: You have resistance to fire damage and psychic damage. In addition, when you are wearing no armor, your AC is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 9

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: vampire curses, Elvish musical expressions, merfolk scholarly jargon, and so on.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 10

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Kor mature at the same rate as humans and live about as long.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most kor are lawful good, with a strong dedication to community and the traditions of their ancestors.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Kor average nearly 6 feet tall, but are much lighter and more slender than humans. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Climbing
trait.text: You also have a climbing speed of 30 feet as long as you are not encumbered or wearing heavy armor.

trait.name: Kor Climbing
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Athletics and Acrobatics skills.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, and communicate in the silent speech of the Kor.

trait.name: Lucky
trait.text: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 13

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the bard spell list. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Creed of the Trickster
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Sleight of Hand and Stealth skills.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Merfolk mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live considerably longer than humans, though, often reaching well over 100 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most merfolk are neutral, though merfolk of the Emeria and Cosi creeds have chaotic leanings.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Merfolk are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Swimming
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Merfolk, and one extra language of your choice.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 13

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the druid spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Wind Creed Manipulation
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Merfolk mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live considerably longer than humans, though, often reaching well over 100 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most merfolk are neutral, though merfolk of the Emeria and Cosi creeds have chaotic leanings.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Merfolk are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Swimming
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Merfolk, and one extra language of your choice.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 13

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Water Creed Navigation
trait.text: You have proficiency with navigator's tools and in the Survival skill.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Merfolk mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live considerably longer than humans, though, often reaching well over 100 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most merfolk are neutral, though merfolk of the Emeria and Cosi creeds have chaotic leanings.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Merfolk are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Swimming
trait.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Merfolk, and one extra language of your choice.

trait.name: Description
trait.text: Source: Plane Shift: Zendikar p. 14

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Vampires don't mature and age in the same way that other races do. Every living vampire is either a bloodchief, infected by Ulamog's influence in the distant reaches of history, or was spawned by a bloodchief from a living human. Most vampires are thus very old, but few have any memory of their earliest years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Vampires have no innate tendency toward evil, but consuming the life energy of other creatures often pushes them to that end. Regardless of their moral bent, the strict hierarchies of their bloodchiefs inclines them toward a lawful alignment.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Vampires are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Blood Thirst
trait.text: You can drain blood and life energy from a willing creature, or one that is grappled by you, incapacitated, or restrained. Make a melee attack against the target. If you hit, you deal 1 piercing damage and 1d6 necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and you regain hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid killed in this way becomes a zombie.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Vampire.

trait.name: Vampiric Resistance
trait.text: You have resistance to necrotic damage.
